【考法 1】 vt. 缓和，减轻：to lessen the intensity of
【例】He couldn't assuage his guilt over the divorce.
【反】aggravate, exacerbate 加强，恶化
【考法 2】 vt. 平息，抚慰：to pacify or calm
【例】Life contains sorrows that cannot be assuaged, and it is important to be honest in acknowledging this.
【近】compose, soothe 安慰；使平静；缓和, calm, pacify使平静；安慰；平定, placate抚慰；使和解, appease, lighten, relieve, alleviate, assuage, allay, mitigate, moderate, conciliate, propitiate
【反】aggravate, annoy, enrage, exasperate, incense, infuriate, ire, irk, irritate, madden, nettle, peeve, provoke, rile, roil, vex 煽动，激起
【考法 3】vt. 使满足：to put an end to by satisfying
【例】assuage his thirst 消渴
【例】That meal certainly assuaged my hunger.
【近】satisfy, sate, satiate, quench
【记】 suad + 柔和温和；persuade 劝说就是能使事情缓和
【另】 dissuade(劝阻),persuade(劝说),suasion(说服),suave(温和,柔和的)
